t: Psalm 31
A Psalm of Complaint and of Praise.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David.
In*pn You, O Lord,*s I have taken refuge; Let*ln me never be ashamed; In*ln Your righteousness deliver me.
Incline*ln Your ear to me, rescue me quickly; Be*ln to me a rock of strength, A*ln stronghold to save me.
For*ln You are my rock and my fortress; For*ln Your name’s sake You will lead me and guide me.
You*ln will pull me out of the net which they have secretly laid for me, For*ln You are my strength.
Into*ln Your hand I commit my spirit; You*ln have ransomed me, O Lord,*s God of truth.
I*ln hate those who regard vain idols, But*ln I trust in the Lord.*s
I*ln will rejoice and be glad in Your lovingkindness, Because*ln You have seen my affliction; You*ln have known the troubles of my soul,
And*ln You have not given me over into the hand of the enemy; You*ln have set my feet in a large place.
Be*ln gracious to me, O Lord,*s for I am in distress; My*ln eye is wasted away from grief, my soul and my body also.*i
For*ln my life is spent with sorrow And*ln my years with sighing; My*ln strength has failed because of my iniquity, And*ln my body has wasted away.
Because*ln of all my adversaries, I have become a reproach, Especially*ln to my neighbors, And*ln an object of dread to my acquaintances; Those*ln who see me in the street flee from me.
I*ln am forgotten as a dead man, out of mind; I*ln am like a broken vessel.
For*ln I have heard the slander of many, Terror*ln is on every side; While*ln they took counsel together against me, They*ln schemed to take away my life.
But*ln as for me, I trust in You, O Lord,*s I*ln say, “You are my God.”
My*ln times are in Your hand; Deliver*ln me from the hand of my enemies and from those who persecute me.
Make*ln Your face to shine upon Your servant; Save*ln me in Your lovingkindness.
Let*ln me not be put to shame, O Lord,*s for I call upon You; Let*ln the wicked be put to shame, let them be silent in Sheol.
Let*ln the lying lips be mute, Which*ln speak arrogantly against the righteous With*ln pride and contempt.
How*ln great is Your goodness, Which*ln You have stored up for those who fear You, Which*ln You have wrought for those who take refuge in You, Before*ln the sons of men!
You*ln hide them in the secret place of Your presence from the conspiracies of man; You*ln keep them secretly in a shelter from the strife of tongues.
Blessed*ln be the Lord,*s For*ln He has made marvelous His lovingkindness to me in a besieged city.
As*ln for me, I said in my alarm, “I*ln am cut off from before Your eyes”; Nevertheless*ln You heard the voice of my supplications When*ln I cried to You.
O*ln love the Lord,*s all you His godly ones! The*ln Lord*s preserves the faithful And*ln fully recompenses the proud doer.
Be*ln strong and let your heart take courage, All*ln you who hope in the Lord.*s
